alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Pulaski and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain moving back into the advisory area from the southwest. Excessive runoff will continue cause minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, Burnside, Pulaski County Park, Frazer, Nancy, Naomi, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu, Mill Springs, Betsey, Trimble and Ferguson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
